page.title: 16HOUSING
page.content: Housing in Skelton is varied with every century from the 17th onwards having some representation in age if not in distinctive style. Houses, bungalows, farmhouses of brick, stone and the modern block built with plaster/shale covering indicate the variety to be seen. There are 10 Council Houses in Skelton, 6 old peoples' bungalows and a small modern development of 18 private bungalows in Phoenix Park. Most houses have reasonably sized gardens which are generally quite productive and are kept in good order. There is no new development taking place at present a stable situation being reached following the Phoenix Park development of the late 1970's.
